The play area, created in 2010, features swings, roundabout, multi play roller coaster, slides and nets. There is also an area specifically for teenagers with a seating area and a football goal flanked on either side which can also be used for basketball. This play area was funded by the City of Edinburgh Council and Waste Recycling Environmental Limited (WREN).

As part of a major upgrade of the park which has recently had a new pavilion and footpaths improved, a new play area was added in 2012 to replace the old one. The new play area provides play for toddlers and juniors with cradle swings and a basket swing, a 4 seat crazy daisy springer, dish roundabout and a dynamic unit called a rodeo board which is mounted on springs but also rotates. For those with an adventuress spirit there is the 3m high Playzone Mountain Climber featuring a giant 2.4m high steel tunnel slide, a 2.1m vertical rope climb, a 1.6m high climbing wall and a 1.8m high fireman's pole. Seating in the form of 3 benches and a picnic table has been recycled from the old play area.

Play area for toddlers and juniors. Located in the grounds of Brunstane School.

There are 40 individual items of play and 4877m square of pure fun. Features include slides, drag ramp, scramble net, pedal roundabout, water play unit, basket buddy swing, tyre swing and specialist swing seats. The play spaces have been designed for easy access and for use by all ages and abilities. There are three ways to enter Magnet Play with entrance points at either end of the central footpath and a crawl through tunnel located in the hedge as a secret entry for children. The blend of exciting play equipment and sculpture set in a park landscape of trees, grass and safer surfaces is visually stunning and attracts over 300 children and adults each day.
Play area for toddlers and juniors.

The play area which was upgraded in 2010 includes a refurbished ‘flying fox’, buddy swing, space net, tunnel slide and balancing beam. There is also a 260m ‘blue’ grade bike track, which is suitable for intermediate riders with basic off road skills.

A new innovative swing that mimics what it feels like to be on a skateboard in a halfpipe was installed in 2010. The ‘Sky Carver’ is the first of its kind in Britain and allows young people to enjoy the sensation of adrenaline fuelled sports such as skateboarding, wake boarding and kite surfing - while being attached to a four metre high aerial rope.
